item.title: Function Objects
item.description: In C++, a function can be treated as an object using function pointers or function objects (also known as functors). Function objects are objects that can be invoked like functions. They provide a way to encapsulate a function within an object, allowing it to be passed around, stored in data structures, or used in algorithms that require callable entities. A functions can be treated as first-class citizens, meaning they can be assigned to variables, passed as arguments to other functions, and returned from functions.
